questions.question: Breaking into the line of a funeral procession is:
choices: Allowed if the funeral procession consists of five or more vehicles

questions.question: Never start to cross railroad tracks if:
choices: You cannot cross and clear the tracks completely
The crossing is marked with a crossbuck sign
You cannot see the tracks for 500 feet in both directions

questions.question: Which is the most crucial driving technique on icy or snowy roads?
choices: Add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction
Reduce speed and increase following distance

questions.question: When approaching a stopped school bus with flashing red lights traveling on your side of an undivided highway with four or more lanes, you must:
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution

questions.question: When may you drive faster than the maximum speed limit?
choices: When driving in the left lane

questions.question: Red and blue signs in the shape of a shield mark:
Which lane is closed for traffic going straight ahead?
choices: Lane A with a steady red X
Lane B with a steady green arrow
Lane C with a steady green arrow

questions.question: When should you use your high-beam headlights?
choices: At night on open roads with no streetlights

questions.question: When an emergency vehicle using flashing lights approaches you from behind, you must:
choices: Proceed at normal speed, the emergency vehicle will move over to pass
Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down
Pull to the right and stop

questions.question: Hydroplaning occurs:
choices: When your tires lose traction on wet pavement

questions.question: Maryland law requires all children younger than age 8 to be in an approved child-safety seat or booster seat, unless:
choices: The vehicle is equipped with airbags
They ride in the back seat

questions.question: Driving under the influence of a drug that impairs your ability to drive safely is:
choices: Legal if it is a prescription drug or an over-the-counter drug
Only illegal if the drug is illegal

questions.question: If you are involved in a traffic crash, you must always:
choices: Immediately move injured people out of the traffic lane
File a traffic crash report with MVA

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
When a traffic signal turns green, you:
choices: Must yield to pedestrians and vehicles already in the intersection
Should not drive faster than 15 mph

questions.question: Yellow pavement markings should generally be on:
choices: On either side, depending  on type of highway

questions.question: If you feel drowsy on a long trip, you should:
choices: Turn off radio and avoid other irregular sounds

questions.question: If you see this sign beside the road, you should:
choices: Be prepared for a traffic signal ahead
Always come to a complete stop
Be prepared for a railroad crossing ahead

questions.question: The minimum vision requirements for all classes of license, with or without glasses or contact lenses, are:
The best way to see problems early and avoid last-minute moves when driving is to:
choices: Always know what is happening around your vehicle
Always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car

questions.question: A combination of these two signs tells you:
choices: The location of a school crossing
There is an unmarked crosswalk ahead

questions.question: When merging onto an interstate or a limited-access highway:
choices: Move directly onto the highway, vehicles on the highway must always yield
Always turn your head to look quickly to the side before changing lanes
Drive faster than highway traffic to find a gap

questions.question: The following are true about large trucks except:
choices: They have bigger blind spots than most cars
They require more room to maneuver

questions.question: You approach an intersection. Where should you stop if there is a stop sign but no stop line or crosswalk?
choices: Where you have a clear view, even if it is within the intersection
You are not required to stop

questions.question: Pink road signs show:
When you proceed straight ahead on a solid green light, you must:
choices: Not enter the intersection if it is blocked

questions.question: When signaled by a police officer to stop, do not:
choices: Pull safely to the shoulder of the road and stop
Turn on your right turn signal
Proceed without acknowledging the officer's presence

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
If a school bus stops on the other side of a four-lane road without median separation and activates flashing red lights, you must:
choices: Stop only if children are crossing the street

questions.question: You follow a large commercial vehicle. If you cannot see the driver's face in the side view mirror:
choices: You should tap your horn a few times
It is best to reduce your following distance

questions.question: When you have a green light at an intersection, and a blind pedestrian enters the intersection in front of your car, you should:
choices: Stop and stay stopped until the pedestrian has crossed

questions.question: You should adjust your seat and mirrors:
choices: Before you get into your vehicle

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
Cancellation of a driving privilege is the same as:
In inclement weather, you should:
choices: Speed up to get off the road quickly

questions.question: Which vehicle must always stop before every highway-rail crossing?
choices: A passenger car with young children

questions.question: Because motorcycles are smaller and more difficult to see than cars:
choices: They are allowed to exceed the speed limit
They can be hidden in your vehicle's blind spot

questions.question: What should you expect ahead when you see this sign?
You are driving a car equipped with airbags. The distance between your breastbone and the airbag cover should be:
Which is one factor that significantly affects your stopping distance?
You are driving on a highway posted for 60 mph. Traffic around you is traveling at 70 mph. You may legally drive:
choices: 70 mph to keep up with traffic

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should:
choices: Slow down and always stop ahead
Slow down and be prepared to merge
Slow down and be prepared to yield

questions.question: On a country road at night, a vehicle with high beams comes toward you. What should you do?
choices: Look down toward the left edge of your lane
Slow down and look slightly to the right of the lane you are traveling in
Drive as closely as possible to the center of the road

questions.question: Hydroplaning can be prevented by driving:
This road sign means:
choices: You must make a complete stop
Drive with caution and be ready to stop

questions.question: Which of the following is a primary factor that affects your ability to digest alcohol?
Backing a vehicle on interstate highways:
choices: Is only allowed in the right-hand lane

questions.question: After passing another vehicle and before returning to your lane, it is a good rule to:
choices: Wait until you are within 200 feet of any oncoming vehicle
Look for the headlights of the passed vehicle in your rear-view mirror

questions.question: A solid wide white line between lanes of traffic means:
What is a basic speed rule?
choices: You must not drive slower than 15 mph
You must keep a speed that is reasonable and cautious considering conditions
You must drive at the same speed as the rest of the traffic

questions.question: MVA will suspend the license of any driver with a BAC test result of:
Crossing double (side by side) solid yellow lines is allowed:
choices: Only as part of a left turn maneuver
Any time it is safe to do so

questions.question: This sign tells you that the center lane must be used for:
Passing another vehicle on the right is:
choices: Allowed on a roadway with two or more lanes in each direction
Allowed if the vehicle you are passing is signaling a right turn
Allowed if you use the shoulder

questions.question: Which lane should you use for a left turn?
choices: Lane B with flashing yellow X
Lane A with steady red X
Lane C with steady green arrow

questions.question: Night driving poses special problems for drivers because:
choices: There are fewer cars on the roads at night
It is more difficult to judge distance and traveling speed of other vehicles
The speed limit is increased at night

questions.question: The primary purpose of this sign is to alert you to the following:
You must turn on your headlights:
choices: When turning on windshield wipers in bad weather
Any time in open country with a clear road ahead

questions.question: You want to turn right ahead. There is a bicyclist just in front of you. What should you do?
Which color are signs that warn you of specific road conditions?
The following are true about large trucks except:
choices: The driver of a truck can see the road better than the driver of a car
They have longer stopping distances than most cars
They accelerate slower than most cars

questions.question: Drivers entering a roundabout:
choices: Have the right of way if they arrive first
Must yield to drivers already in the roundabout

questions.question: You approach an intersection with a stop sign and a stop line painted across the pavement. You must:
choices: Stop at a point  where it is possible to see clearly in all directions

questions.question: If you strike and injure a domestic animal, you must:
choices: Move the animal off the roadway
File a crash report with the MVA

questions.question: What do the light gray areas in the picture mark?
You should adjust your seat and mirrors:
choices: When driving and light conditions change
When driving and road conditions change

questions.question: Before turning left, it is essential to:
choices: Move to the right side of your lane

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
When you want to pass a motorcycle from behind, you must:
choices: Encourage the motorcycle to move onto the shoulder
Share the lane but keep to the left side
Allow plenty of space between your vehicle and the motorcycle

questions.question: If your car starts to skid, you should:
choices: Brake hard and steer off the road
Take your foot off the gas pedal
Pump your brakes and keep steering
